io.mosip.registration.service.packet.impl

Class PacketEncryptionServiceImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.mosip.registration.service.packet.impl.PacketEncryptionServiceImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PacketEncryptionService

    @Service
public class PacketEncryptionServiceImpl
extends Object
implements PacketEncryptionService
    This class encrypts the Registration packet using RSA and AES algorithms. Then saves the encrypted packet and acknowledgement receipt in the specified location. And adds an entry in the Registration table
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Balaji Sridharan

    • Method Detail

      • encrypt

        public ResponseDTO encrypt(RegistrationDTO registrationDTO,
                           byte[] packetZipData)
                    throws RegBaseCheckedException
        Description copied from interface: PacketEncryptionService
        Encrypts the input data using AES algorithm followed by RSA and stores the encrypted data in the specified location.

        This method does the following:

        1. Encrypts the input data using AES algorithm followed by RSA algorithm
        2. Validates the size of the encrypted data against the configured size. If exceeds the configured size, information will be logged in the logger
        3. Saves the encrypted data in the local system
        4. Save the registration details in the Registration table
        5. Save the details of audits attached with the packet against the registration ID in the AuditLogControl table

        Returns the ResponseDTO object. If all the above processes had completed successfully, SuccessResponseDTO will be set in ResponseDTO object

        Specified by:
        encrypt in interface PacketEncryptionService
        Parameters:
        registrationDTO - the RegistrationDTO containing the registration details
        packetZipData - the data to be encrypted
        Returns:
        the ResponseDTO
        Throws:
        RegBaseCheckedException - the checked exception
